intro: Diodia radula subsp. venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan sandweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct genetic and morphological traits compared to other Diodia species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and biodiversity in tropical ecosystems.
